p: To address these past inequities and plan current approaches, we saw collaboration across institutions. For instance, Dhody, Lord, Mahoney, Shaw, and their colleagues in medical museums and federal history offices across the United States have talked biweekly since April to share resources and address collecting efforts. Ricia Anne Chansky, whose Mi María mass-listening project documents the effects of Hurricane Maria on the people of Puerto Rico, realized that the protocols she had developed could be shared with the partner universities and community groups of the Humanities Action Lab, to link first-person narratives of COVID-19 to climate justice.
